storyInfo: After the Catastrophe, the children gather to listen to the last part of the hunter's legend. The female scholar ponders the village's future. Yato and Noir Corne return to the ruins of Roka and witness the Rathalos's end.

attributes.content: In the end, the hunter didn't defeat the monster.
But the villagers had left, leaving behind only empty ruins to burn in the flames.
Wounded and without a target, the monster roared and bellowed, and returned to the forest on its own.
As though leaving with the parting words:
'I'll be back.'
The hunter stands quietly facing the forest. A long time passes before he answers.
What? The hunter doesn't beat the monster? Lame!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Yeah, he's the greatest hunter in the village! Why couldn't he beat the monster?
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: That's just how the story goes.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: But the Rathalos that attacked the village got away.
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: It's 'cause they were all too weak. When I become a hunter, I'll chase that Rathalos away in the blink of an eye!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Cut it out! I saw it with my own eyes. You're no match for it!
attributes.name: Kazuya

attributes.content: Look! What do you think this is?
attributes.name: Kazuya

attributes.content: The spear used to hunt the Rathalos!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Yato told me to take care of it for now, which means I'm worthy of carrying it. I'm the one who's gonna be the greatest hunter in the whole village. You just go home and sleep!
attributes.name: Kazuya

attributes.content: I dare you to say that again! Spirit Helm Breaker! Take that!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Alright, kids, that's enough.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: What did the hunter say in the end?
attributes.name: Curious Child

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: It's time for lunch. Go eat, and I'll continue the hunter's story afterwards.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: Go on now.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: Mirai... it's already been half a month, but sometimes it feels like it was yesterday.
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Your memory is improving.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: I've never forgotten about Akira... Is old Kashiwau awake?
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Still in a coma, but the doctor says he's gotten a lot better. He has a lot of life in him yet.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: Things have been so busy lately, new streets and new houses...
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Good thing we'd saved up some money from the Originium mining, and made Hiroshi Ritou cough up the money he embezzled.
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: The beginning is the easy part though. The question is what kind of industry should the village pursue...
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Mirai, can't we try the Suzuka cultivation method you mentioned, once things have settled down?
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Oh, I was lying about that.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: L-Lying?
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: You know how sensitive Suzuka herbs are. It's not really feasible to cultivate them outside their native habitat with current technology.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: But you said—
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: You guys would never have been willing to move if I didn't. You lost your wits in the face of danger and Ritou played you like a fiddle. I had to find a way to get people to leave.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: The future... Just thinking about the livelihood of the village is making my head hurt.
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Actually, I do have an idea.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: Really?
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Really.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: Go ahead then, I'm listening.
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: We can make use of our experience working in the mines.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: We can have our people go out to work in mature Originium projects and bring back safe, established technologies relying on existing supply chains.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: Do you realize what you're saying? We finally managed to escape that Originium mine, and now you're trying to send us back in?
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Weren't you one who wanted to blow it up?
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: It wasn't about the mine itself, but the fact that you were digging up more than you could manage, and none of you would listen to reason.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: We've been working directly with Originium ore for so long and gained so much experience. That can only come in handy.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: Originium is too dangerous. Catastrophe, Oripathy... are we really going to go back to living in fear?
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Even so, Uncle, there's nowhere in Terra we can avoid living alongside Originium.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: The bright lights of the great cities are fueled by the Originium industry, after all.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: It's too late to turn our backs on it and go back to the old ways.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: But... how can we...?
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Starting over doesn't mean abandoning everything we once had.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: What we know about the Originium industry is just the tip of the iceberg. We need to move forward, learn from mature industrial systems, and gain more experience.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: We'll learn to benefit from Originium in a safe, controlled manner.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: We brought this disaster on ourselves because of our short-sightedness, but that doesn't mean we have to abandon the idea entirely.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: On the contrary, we must learn to respect Originium and respect the destruction it can cause, in order to fully enjoy the opportunities that it brings.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: We shouldn't let the sacrifices of the past go to waste. Besides, we have our friends from Rhodes Island helping us now.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: You're right. I should think about the village's future in more practical terms.
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: Originium industry... I don't know how much of our existing experience will apply, but like you said, it's worth a try.
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: And when the situation in the village improves, can you build me a beautiful lab with the latest technologies?
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: What? What are you planning?
attributes.name: Ataru Takii

attributes.content: To cultivate Suzuka outside its native habitat, of course. Along with other research, with the aim of breaking free from a reliance on Originium.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: To bring us closer to a day when we won't have to cower in the shadow of disaster, when we can stand tall and look towards the light...
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: Towards tomorrow.
attributes.name: Mirai Takii

attributes.content: I-I'm still worried, Yato. What if the Doctor finds out that we took a detour here on our way back from the mission?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Are you going to tell them?
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Of course not!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Here we are.
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Wow... Everything really was destroyed by the Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: The whole hill was reduced to ashes. And those ashes rose into the clouds and continue to fall even now...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: How long has it been, Corne?
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Half a month.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Already? Feels like it happened yesterday.
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: I heard the Felynes have been integrated into Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Yes. The official name is the Felyne Task Force, led by the Palico, but the Scholar insists on calling it the Terra Research Commission and claims to be the leader.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: They deal with unusual lifeforms, record the flora and fauna of Terra... and look for a way home.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: The Palico added that last bit, because apparently Arty and Scholar have completely forgotten about it.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: ...Yeah, I can imagine the Scholar's excitement.
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: The rebuilding of Roka is underway too. Everything's getting better, don't worry.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mm... do you know why I came here?
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Not to reminisce about the past, that's for sure.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: You know me so well.
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Do you remember the Rathalos?
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Ah... the monitoring report says it hasn't left the Soubo Mountains. It can be seen circling them amidst the cloud of ashes from time to time.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: It won't be easy to spot it from a place like this. Lemme take a look...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: It's right there, up in the sky.
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Where? Oh, I see it now.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I came to...
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: (Catches a piece of ash)
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Witness its fall.
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: The Rathalos flies towards the skies among the drifting ashes.
It flies further and further, as though drawn by a thread.
A thread that would inevitably break at some point.
Then, it will fall towards the earth.
He looks to his right and sees her gazing towards the sky.
His gaze slowly moves downwards, stopping at her fingertips.
(Reaches out)
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Oh, er... You got some ash on your shoulder.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Are you... smiling?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: It's nothing. Let's go.
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: 'I'll be here.'
The hunter said.
At the end of the story, many years have passed, new houses have been built in the village, and the forest looks different.
The young hunter stands where the old hunter once did, facing the monster born anew.
They gaze into each other's eyes.
